title: 105_hr4068
content: The text amends the authorization for 99-year leases on restricted Indian lands, specifically adding lands held in trust for the Confederated Tribes of the Grand Ronde Community of Oregon and the Cabazon Indian Reservation. The text amends the Grand Ronde Reservation Act by increasing the acreage of land designated for the Confederated Tribes of the Grand Ronde Community of Oregon. The text lists various land parcels with specific coordinates and acreages designated for different uses. The text lists land parcels with specific coordinates and acreages for different uses, totaling 10,311.60 acres. SEC. 3 of the Navajo-Hopi Land Dispute Settlement Act is amended to clarify water rights on designated lands. SEC. 4 addresses the treatment of certain demonstration projects. The Secretary of the Interior is required to extend the terms of projects under the Indian Health Care Improvement Act. Additionally, there is an amendment to the Act authorizing appropriations for fiscal years 2001 and 2002. Section 7(b) of the Coos, Lower Umpqua, and Siuslaw Restoration Act is amended to include a description of a parcel in Lane County, Oregon. This parcel is located in section 23, township 18 south, range 12 west, Willamette Meridian, and is approximately .062 of an acre in size. Additionally, there is a boundary adjustment for the Hoopa Valley Reservation. SEC. 6. Hoopa Valley Reservation boundary adjustment: amends section 2(b) by changing degrees for east and south directions. Section 2 of the Act for the Confederated Tribes of Siletz Indians is amended to include additional counties in Oregon for Federal assistance programs. The Lower Sioux Indian Community in Minnesota is authorized to sell real property in Redwood County without US approval. The property is described in detail, including its location and boundaries. The Lower Sioux Indian Community in Minnesota can sell real property in Redwood County without US approval. The property is located on the north and south quarter line of Section 5, covering 13.38 acres, subject to highway easements, and not including lands held in trust by the United States. The Cow Creek Band of Umpqua Tribe of Indians Recognition Act is amended to include a new section allowing certain property to be taken into trust. The Secretary of the Interior is authorized to accept title to 2000 acres of real property in the Umpqua River watershed or the Rogue River watershed for the benefit of the Tribe, to be included in the Tribe's reservation and not for gaming purposes. SEC. 10 of the Jicarilla Apache Tribe Water Rights Settlement Act is amended to change the deadline from December 31, 1998, to December 31, 2000. A new section, SEC. 12, approves a Stipulation and Settlement Agreement dated October 7, 1997. Section 105(c) of the San Luis Rey Indian Water Rights Settlement Act is amended to authorize the Secretary to disburse $8,000,000 for economic development of the Bands, their reservation land, and members, from interest income accrued to the Fund. The funds cannot be used for per capita payments to Band members, and the United States is not liable for any claims. The United States is not liable for any claims arising from the Bands' use of funds distributed from the Fund. SEC. 12. NATIVE HAWAIIAN HEALTH SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM. The Native Hawaiian Health Care Improvement Act is amended to update eligibility requirements and terms and conditions for the scholarship program. The Native Hawaiian Health Care Improvement Act is amended to update eligibility requirements and terms for the scholarship program, including primary health services covered and obligated service requirements for recipients. The Native Hawaiian Health Care Improvement Act is amended to update eligibility requirements and terms for the scholarship program, including primary health services covered and obligated service requirements for recipients. It includes locations in Hawaii with designations similar to those made by the Secretary through the Public Health Service. The Native Hawaiian Health Care Improvement Act is amended to update scholarship program requirements, including service obligations and exemptions for National Health Service Corps membership. Miscellaneous technical corrections are also included. SEC. 13. MISCELLANEOUS TECHNICAL CORRECTIONS. Amendments are made to the Indian Health Care Improvement Act and the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act. SEC. 14. REPEAL. Repeal of a section in Public Law 105-83 and an amendment to Public Law 104-324.
